result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J McGaffick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Restitution to victim was paid in full prior to sentencing.

No Contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Any letter of apology to be forwarded through probation agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
Not to possess any dangerous weapons (Except for his involvement with the Army Reserves.)
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked. See Count 2 for additional conditions.
Concurrent with:

records.addlTxt: Order imposing 60 days of condition time with Huber, due to probation violations.
Dated 11/11/16, from Probation Agent Braunschweig to Judge Carter, requesting to impose the stayed 60 days condition time. Proposed amendment to JOC attached.
from Family Service of Waukesha dated 10/27/15

Defendant Brandon J McGaffick in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rothstein makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS (1 day credit, if revoked)    *CONCURRENT*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint - any letter of apology must go through probation agent  
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management;
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons (except for his involvement with Army Reserves)  

RESTITUTION:  PAID IN FULL

COSTS:  $243.00  & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted)

***Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.***


COUNT #3:  2 YEARS  (1 day credit, if revoked)   *CONCURRENT*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint - any letter of apology must go through probation agent  
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management;
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons (except for his involvement with Army Reserves)  

RESTITUTION:  PAID IN FULL

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder due as a condition of probation)

***Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.***

CONDITION TIME:  90 DAYS - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 11/3/15 by 5:00 p.m. -LAST 60 DAYS STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion) 


COUNT #4:   2 YEARS  (1 day credit, if revoked)   *CONCURRENT*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint - any letter of apology must go through probation agent  
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management;
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons (except for his involvement with Army Reserves)  

RESTITUTION:  PAID IN FULL

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

***Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.***


***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon J McGaffick in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #2, 3 and 4 on amended information.  Court finds Defendant guilty of Counts #2, 3 and 4 on amended information.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State states that restitution has been paid in full and provides note providing proof.  Attorney Rothstein requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant Brandon J McGaffick in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rothstein requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or victim's residence.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Brandon J McGaffick in court, in custody.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
